Dialogue.content: Hi, I'm Maya Patel. It's nice to meet you.
Hi Maya! It's great to meet you too. How are you feeling today?
I'm feeling a bit overwhelmed with the start of the semester. I just finished an internship that was really challenging.
I understand, starting a new semester can be tough, especially after a demanding internship. What aspects have you found the most overwhelming?
I received some feedback on my projects that felt quite critical, and it made me doubt my skills, especially with my dad being a biochemist.
Receiving critical feedback can sting and really impact your confidence. How has this made you see your own abilities?
It's made me anxious and self-critical, which is hard because I really want to succeed in my Biochemistry major.
It's okay to feel that way. Many students experience pressure, especially when they feel compared to family expectations. Have you talked to anyone about how you're feeling?
Not yet. I don't want to seem weak or like I can't handle my studies.
Hi again. I spoke to my brother about how I've been feeling.
That's great to hear, Maya! How did that conversation go?
It felt somewhat relieving, but I still struggle with voicing my thoughts in group projects because my classmates are so confident.
I'm glad talking to him helped. It's common to feel intimidated in collaborative settings. What makes it difficult for you to share your thoughts?
I fear that my contributions won't be valued, so I often hold back.
That's a normal fear. Maybe setting small goals for each group session, like contributing just one idea, could help you ease into it.
That sounds like a good idea. I'll try to speak up at least once next time.
Fantastic! Remember, your ideas are valuable, and everyone's contributions matter in a team. Let's see how it goes next time.
Hi! I'm back, but I've been feeling increasingly anxious.
Welcome back, Maya! What's been happening since our last chat?
I attended a family gathering, and my brother was talking about his medical school success, making me feel inadequate.
I'm sorry you felt that way. Family comparisons can be tough. How did this affect your thoughts about your own studies?
It heightened my feelings of inadequacy. I worry I won't measure up to my family's expectations and it makes me question my path in biochemistry.
That's understandable; it's easy to feel overshadowed. Have you taken time to reflect on your own passions and achievements in the field?
Not really. I've been too focused on feeling inferior.
Hi, I'm back again! I took your advice and started writing down my achievements.
Hi Maya! That's wonderful to hear! How did that go for you?
It was eye-opening and it made me realize that I've accomplished quite a bit. This helped me feel a bit more grounded.
That's fantastic! Holding onto those positive reflections can help guide you through tough times. How do you feel about your studies moving forward?
I feel a little more optimistic about engaging in my program, but I still struggle with participating in class discussions.
Optimism is a great first step! For class participation, sharing your reflections or personal insights on topics you're passionate about can help. What could you share next time?
I could talk about an environmental issue I researched recently that really resonated with me.
